data.Name: Moody Cow Meditates
Author: Kerry Lee MacLean
data.Notes: Moody Cow is Peter, whose grandfather taught him a way to tune in with his angry feelings and settle his mind through focused meditation after a bad day. Learn how to make your own mind jar and control your negative emotions! The publisher, Wisdom Publications, is affiliated with the Foundation for the Preservation of Mahayana Tradition.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number PZ10.3.

data.Name: The Dalai Lama: a biography of the Tibetan spiritual and political leader
Author: Demi
data.Notes: This book tells the story of the search for the successor of the thirteenth Dalai Lama, after his passing in 1933. With simplicity and beauty, the author blends text and illustrations to describe the extraordinary life and vision of a kind and beloved master. The author is a Buddhist practitioner. Foreword written by HH Dalai Lama.
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ7935 .B777.

data.Name: The Empty Pot
Author: Demi
data.Notes: Ping, the hero of this Chinese folktale, is unable to grow the seed distributed by the Emperor. This book will help you determine what is best: the empty truth or the beauty of illusion. Demi's books for children have been awarded for making a positive difference in the world.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number PZ8.1.D38.

data.Name: Anh's Anger
Author: Gail Silver
data.Notes: By “sitting“ with his anger, Anh learns how to identify and deal with his feelings. Using a variety of techniques, Anh is able to calm himself down and transform his strong emotions. Based on teachings on mindfulness and Buddhism by the Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh, a well-known poet and peace activist.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number PZ7.S58567.

data.Name: Where is Tibet? = Bod ga pa yod red = Poo kabah yoreh: a story in Tibetan and English
Author: Gina Halpern
data.Notes: In this bi-lingual book, two Tibetan refugee children living in India search for their homeland, and find it within their hearts and minds. Richly illustrated in Tibetan style, it encourages materials for children to explore Tibetan letters.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number PZ90 .T58.

data.Name: A Friend to All
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This adaptation of a Jataka story of one of the Buddha's previous lives teaches that genuine loving kindness is extended even to those who are unpleasant and rude. A kind woodpecker saves the life of an ungrateful lion who later reviles him, but the woodpecker's kindness and friendship remains unchanged. At the end, there is a guide for parents and teachers on the story, bringing the story to life, teaching values through play, active reading, and daily activities.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5.

data.Name: The Life of the Great Mahasiddha Virupa
Author: HE Dagmo Kalden D. Sakya
data.Notes: This book was carefully produced by HE Dagmo Kalden D. Sakya, the wife of His Holiness the Ratna Vajra Sakya, to teach young children all over the world about Mahasiddha Virupa, one of the famous eighty-four great Indian Masters who attained great realizations in one lifetime. An explanation of terms and expressions, and a Q&A section, can be found at the end of the book.
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ7672.4 .D63.

data.Name: Prince Siddhartha: the story of Buddha
Author: Jonathan Landaw
data.Notes: In the graceful telling of Siddhartha’s life - his childhood, his awakening and his teachings - sensitive issues such as death and suffering are touched upon. Learning about Buddha can help children become more thoughtful and aware of altruism, nonviolence and loving-kindness. The publisher, Wisdom Publications, is affiliated with the Foundation for the Preservation of Mahayana Tradition.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ892 .L36.

data.Name: Buddhist Stories - Pancharatna Series No. 1017
Author: Anant Pai (editor)
data.Notes: This is a compilation of several Amar Chitra Katha titles (Buddha; Angulimala; Amrapali and Upagupta; King Kusha; and The Acrobat), stories that teach about right conduct, good deeds, nonviolence, devotion and skillfulness. The comic-book style of the compilation is an interesting and fun way to learn about Indian mythology and the Buddha's teachings.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ882 .P35.

data.Name: Sras mo Me-tog-lha-mdzes = Princess Metok Lhazey
Author: Kalsang Khedup
data.Notes: A Tibetan folk tale about the blessings of prayers to Tara that turn sadness to happiness for a king, his beautiful daughter, and her true love. In Tibetan and English with illustrations in the Tibetan style.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number GR337 .S56.

data.Name: Heart of Gold
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This adaptation of a Jataka story of one of the Buddha's previous lives explains how the merit of generosity brings both temporary and ultimate happiness. A generous rich man loses his possessions but becomes even more generous, eventually attaining the perfection of wisdom. At the end, there is a guide for parents and teachers on the story, bringing the story to life, active reading and playing, daily activities, and vocabulary.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5H43.

data.Name: Dazhun Gongkar Choede School Magazine
Author: Gongkar Choede Monastery
data.Notes: A collection of short essays by young monks in Sakya Gongkar Choede Monastery on topics that inspire them: 'The most unforgettable day in my life,' 'Monastery Life,' 'My root guru,' etc. Provides a sweet and poignant look inside the lives and thoughts of youth growing up in a monastery in India.
data.Access: This book is out of print. A copy is available for review in the Tsechen Kunchab Ling Library, 12 Edmunds Lane, Walden NY.

data.Name: Milarepa - a great saint of Tibet - Wisdom of Tibet series
Author: the Council for Tibetan Education
data.Notes: The life of the great master Milarepa comes up as a comic book as a initiative of the Council for Tibetan Education in order to bring out more general reading materials for Tibetan readers particularly children.
data.Access: The book is available in both Tibetan and English, it can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ7950 .M557 198.

data.Name: The Buddhist World
Author: Anne Bancroft
data.Notes: This entertaining encyclopedia provides an overview of a myriad number of topics in Buddhism, such as the differentiation between Buddha and Buddhists, Buddha's life and teachings, teachings on living and dying, holy dates and places, and more. A glossary, as well as suggested books for further reading, are included at the end of the encyclopedia.
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ4035 .B36.

data.Name: The greatest man who ever lived: the Supreme Buddha
Author: Ven. Weragoda Sarada Maha Thero
Tags: Buddha's teachings aka Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, interdependent origination, five aggregates, etc.
data.Notes: This illustrated book by a Thai monastic scholar presents thought-provoking perspectives on the Buddha's life and activities, relating them to the concerns of contemporary society. It contains many little-known facts about the Buddha's life combined with quotations from the sutras and contemporary illustrations.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ882 .W67.

data.Name: The Monster of Lotus Lake
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This adaptation of a Jataka story of one of the Buddha's previous lives teaches how decisions about the choices we make are best when filled with both wisdom and compassion. A wise brother saves his brother and step-brother from a demon by careful analysis of right and wrong and ultimately converts the demon who threatened them into a friend. The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5W56.

data.Name: Freedom in Exile: the autobiography of the Dalai Lama
Author: the XIV Dalai Lama
Tenzin Gyatso
data.Notes: Read the story of this great master, told by the 14th Dalai Lama himself, a brilliant, noble and humble human being with a keen sense of humor. The autobiography unearths Tibetan culture and the historic events which brought remarkable Buddhist teachers to the West, and also focuses on the Dalai Lama’s philosophy on tradition, environment, science and world conflicts.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ7935 .B777.

data.Name: Old path white clouds: walking in the footsteps of the Buddha
Author: Thich Nhat Hanh
data.Notes: This is an in-depth recount of the life of the great master Gautama Buddha over the course of his 80 years. Written by Thich Nhat Hanh, a renowned Zen master, poet, and peace activist. The Appendix contains helpful abbreviations used for sutras.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ882 .N4813.

data.Name: The Tree of Enlightenment: an introduction to the major traditions of Buddhism
Author: Peter Della Santina
Tags: Buddha's teachings aka Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, interdependent origination, five aggregates, etc.
data.Notes: The book is a very clear and interesting introduction to Tibetan Buddhism by a Western scholar who became a Sakyapa monk. The forty-one chapters explain the basics of Buddhism, Mahayana, Vajrayana, and the abhidharma, deftly combining Tibetan and Western approaches.
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ4165 .D45.

data.Name: The Beautiful Garland of White Lotuses An Account of the Life of the Great Vajradhara Kyabgön Gongma Trichen Rinpoche
Author: Khenpo Palden Gyatso
data.Notes: Learn about the inspiring life of the 41st Sakya Trizin, head of the Sakya Order of Tibetan Buddhism, through the depiction of his devoted scholar, Khenpo Palden Gyatso. Beautiful illustrations portray elements such as Tibetan culture, lineage gurus, Sakya main deities, and more.
data.Access: This book is available from address: Xiang Qing Tang Street 15-4 , Aba Town, Aba County, Aba Prefecture, Sichuan Province, People's Republic of China(中国四川省阿坝藏族羌族自治州阿坝县阿坝镇阿坝县香清塘街15-4  感恩吃素食), zipcode：624600, receiver: Tang Ka Jia Cuo(唐卡加措), contact number: 0086-13438790259. And a copy is available for review in the Tsechen Kunchab Ling Library, 12 Edmunds Lane, Walden NY.

data.Name: The Boy Who Understood Animals
Author: Yeshi Dorjee
John S Major
data.Notes: This illustrated short tale presents Tenzin's compassionate efforts to help a sheep and a sick girl, with whom he ends up getting married to. This story is an adaptation from The Three Boys and Other Buddhist Folktales from Tibet, written by the same authors. Highlights of the book include a citation of a sutra at the beginning, and a list of suggested discussion questions at the end.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: The Fundamentals of Buddhism
Author: Peter Della Santina
Tags: Buddha's teachings aka Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, interdependent origination, five aggregates, etc.
data.Notes: The book is a very clear and interesting introduction to Tibetan Buddhism by a Western scholar who became a Sakyapa monk. The forty-one chapters explain the basics of Buddhism, Mahayana, Vajrayana, and the abhidharma, deftly combining Tibetan and Western approaches.
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ4055 .D44.

data.Name: The Life of The Buddha According to Thai Temple Paintings
Author: The Council of Thai Bhikkhus in the U.S.A.
data.Publisher: The Council of Thai Bhikkhus in the U.S.A.
data.Notes: A collection of mural paintings from several temples in Thailand, arranged chronologically with commentaries by ecclesiastical leaders and members of the Thai Theravada Sangha. A masterpiece!
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: The magic life of Milarepa, Tibet's great yogi
Author: Eva Van Dam
data.Notes: Written in comic book-style, this is the classical story of the life of the great Kagyu master Milarepa. It demonstrates that black deeds such as jealousy and hatred perpetuate destruction, fear, and unhappiness, and that white deeds accumulated on the Dharma path, especially diligence, meditation, and most importantly, following the guru's advice, bring happiness and eventual liberation from samsara. A dramatic story filled with miraculous deeds and accomplishments, it is sure to inspire youth to virtue.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: Lord of the dance: the autobiography of a Tibetan lama
Author: Chagdud Tulku
data.Notes: The biography of the Nyingma master, Chagdud Tulku, the great lama Sherab Gyaltsen in his previous life, is an inspirational story. Through this book, one can explore Chagdud's life as a human being who experienced situations of desire and aversion, yet always applied Dharma practices in order to purify the obstacles he faced. His life demonstrates that one can still improve and prevail amidst the difficulties that arise in samsara.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ946 .A345.

data.Name: Morals in The Life Story of the Buddha
Author: Margaret Lisa Knight
data.Notes: Inspired by Theravada teachings, this is a collection of lesson plans based on moral values demonstrated by the life of Buddha. This is a great resource for Dharma centers or for homeschooling dharma studies. Lessons are skillfully organized in the following structure: - Opening chants, meditation and review of last lesson - Question to think about before the story - The story - Questions about the story - Quotation from the Buddha about the moral of the story - Application of the moral of the story to our daily lives - Activity to reinforce the lesson - Closing chant
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: Secret of the Healing Treasures
Author: Dharma Publishing
data.Notes: This ancient Tibetan tale follows King Gesar as he frees an enslaved kingdom from evil magicians, saves his people and others by releasing magical herbs to all, and shows people how to live with compassion and peace. Read about how peace, harmony, and enlightenment will prevail in the world! The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BL 1950 .T5S34.

data.Name: The Fish King
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: When the lake creatures are endangered, the king of the fishes successfully uses his past virtuous actions to beseech higher powers to save them. How can being virtuous help us in our own lives? The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5C66.

data.Name: The Magic of Patience
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: Despite the fact that the mischievous monkey constantly teases the buffalo, the buffalo remains patient. His continued compassion eventually teaches the monkey the values of kindness, patience, and sensitivity. When can patience help us in our own lives? The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5M34.

data.Name: Golden Foot
Author: Dharma Publishing
Nazli Gellek
Karen Stone
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A noble doe named Graceful offers her life to save her mate Golden Foot, the king of the deer, when he is caught in a hunter’s snare. This act of loving kindness changes the hunter who then releases Golden Foot. Golden Foot and Graceful set a wise and compassionate example for us all! The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5M36.

data.Name: The Value of Friends
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: In this story about the importance of friends, a hawk, following his wife’s advice, becomes friends with an osprey, a tortoise, and a lion. When hunters try to capture their children, the friends come together and save the baby birds. How can you help your friends? The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5N35.

data.Name: A Precious Life
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A king becomes trapped in a deep ravine, while trying to hunt a deer. The deer risks his own life to save his hunter. The grateful king renounces hunting and resolves to protect all the lives of all the forest creatures. How can we protect the lives of animals around us? This book serves as an inspiration for life practices. The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5P54.

data.Name: The Parrot and the Fig Tree
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A parrot lives in a fig tree surrounded by many other birds who continually search for better trees with the best fruit. However the parrot remains loyal to his friend, the tree, even when he is tested by the king of the gods. Let’s all become true, devoted friends like the parrot! The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5P54

data.Name: Wisdom of the Golden Goose
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: After a king sends his hunters to trap him as a gift to his sick wife, the Golden Goose chooses to willingly go to the palace and teaches the king about compassion and goodness. We should all follow Golden Goose’s wise advice! The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5.

data.Name: The Hunter and the Quail
Author: Dharma Publishing
Nazli Gellek
Trudy Crofts
Ken McKeon

data.Notes: A wise quail teaches the other birds how to escape a hunter’s net through teamwork. The birds who learn to cooperate live in safety, while those who quarrel are caught. Let’s all learn how to work together! The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5H76.

data.Name: Pieces of Gold
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A young man realizes that his greed and dishonesty only harms himself after he unsuccessfully tries to cheat his older brother out of his inheritance. In the end the older brother shows his generosity and brotherly spirit by still sharing the inheritance with him. How does selfiness hurt us in our own lives? The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5M5.

data.Name: A Wise Ape Teaches Kindness
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A kind ape rescues a hungry farmer trapped in a ravine. However when the ape rests, the farmer tries to kill him. Nonetheless, the ape continues to be compassionate and brings the farmer to safety, teaching him a lesson. How can we be compassionate towards difficult people? The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5W57.

data.Name: Three Wise Birds
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A king without an heir chooses to raise three birds as his children, but is mocked for doing so. In response, the king has the birds demonstrate their wisdom to the public. Their teachings are honored and heeded by all the people, who realize wisdom can come unusual sources. True leadership requires standing up for your beliefs and heeding the advice of wise counselors. The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5Z68.

data.Name: The Rabbit Who Overcame Fear
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A wise lion saves the forest animals from disaster after a young rabbit’s blind fear endangered them all. The rabbit and the other animals all learn how to cope with fear better. Learning how to deal with emotions such as fear is a step forward to become wiser. The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5C66.

data.Name: The Rabbit in the Moon
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A rabbit offers his own body as food to a hungry stranger in an act of compassion. The rabbit is rewarded by being placed in the moon, where he remains to this day, reminding the world of the power of selflessness. After reading, look up at the moon and find the shape of the noble rabbit! The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5R33.

data.Name: The Courageous Captain
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A famous retired sea captain accompanies a ship of young sailors who are searching for treasure and teaches them that good actions are more reliable than hopes. The sailors succeed when they finally follow the elderly captain’s advice. Whose advice should we listen to when we need help? The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5C68.

data.Name: The King Who Understood Animals
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: In return for saving a snake’s life, King Senaka is given a charm that allows him to understand him the speech of animals which he must keep secret on the cost of his life. However, he later endangers himself by agreeing to disclose it. In the end, King Senaka realizes the dangers of thoughtless promises, selfishness, and greed after being counseled by a wise goat. What must we consider when making a promise? The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5M34.

data.Name: I Once Was a Monkey: Stories Buddha Told
Author: Jeanne M. Lee
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A statue of Buddha comes to life to tell a group of animals stuck in a cave six stories of his past lives, known as Jataka tales. These stories teach the animals some of the central tenets of Buddhist teachings, such as compassion, honesty, and thinking before acting. Let’s pass our time with these animals and learn from the Buddha’s example!
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5L44.

data.Name: Becoming Buddha the Story of Siddhartha
Author: Whitney Stewart
data.Notes: This picture book tells the story of Gautma Buddha’s life from birth to enlightenment in a simple and understandable manner for children. HH the 14th Dalai Lama wrote the foreword to the book and at the end of the book HH has advice geared towards children on how to meditate. After reading the Buddha’s story, let’s all follow his example and learn how to meditate!
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ882 .S74.

data.Name: Great Gift and the Wish-Fulfilling Gem
Author: Lama Mipham
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: In a past life the Buddha was reincarnated as a Great Gift, a kind-hearted child of a minister. Great Gift seeing the problems of the poor seeks out a wish-fulfilling gem to help them. What can we do in our own lives to help the poor? The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5G74.

data.Name: The Dalai Lama on What Matters Most, Conversations on Anger, Compassion, and Action
Author: Noriyuki Ueda
data.Notes: The book is a record of author’s interview with HH Dalai Lama. Short chapters on “What Can Buddhism Offer”, “Compassionate Anger”, “Love vs Attachment” and, “Enlightened Buddhism in Modern World.” Very accessible, friendly format not difficult language. Author teaches cultural anthropology and social reform theory at Tokyo Institute of Technology. Author has personal history of social activism and has been disappointed by his experience. He found those working for inner peace suffering inner turmoil. And that the turmoil was what informed their work in the world. Even though all members of his group preached peace and espoused the same goals, they could not work together harmoniously or peacefully. Author also experienced disappointment with traditional Japanese Buddhist practices labeling it “funeral buddhism” Author found Japanese monks preached compassion but failed in its practice. He brought these concerns and asked the HH Dalai Lama, how to create an altruistic society.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ7935 .B774.

data.Name: Buddhist Sunday School Lessons
Author: Venerable Sumangalo
data.Notes: This book was made to be used in Sunday schools, in primary and secondary schools, and for home-instruction of children by parents. It includes prayers, stories, and test questions to accompany the major Buddhist teachings. The book was published by a group of Straits Chinese Buddhists.
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ7935 .B774.

data.Name: 101 Jataka Tales
Author: Om Books International
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This book is a compilation of Jataka tales, stories of the Buddha’s previous lives. Each tale is only one page long, includes an important lesson, and is accompanied by a beautiful illustration making them perfect short stories for children. You can make reading a tale or two part of your bedtime routine!
data.Access: It can be ordered online.

data.Name: The Buddha’s Question
Author: W.W. Rowe
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: The Buddha teaches a group of children about loving kindness by recounting a story from his past life. This book is based on chapter thirty of Vietanmese Zen Buddhist teacher Thich Nhat Hanh’s recounting of the life and teachings of Gautama Buddha Old Path White Clouds. This version of the story is rhymed and has wonderful illustrations to make it more appealing to young children. The fun rhymes will make this your children’s favorite book in no time!
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462 .E5R69.

data.Name: Tibetan Tales for Little Buddha
Author: Naomi C. Rose
data.Notes: With stories written in both English and Tibetan, this collection of three traditional tales include great insight into Tibetan culture and wisdom. The beginning of the book includes information on Tibet, a traditional mantra children can use, and has a list of vocabulary words relating to Buddhism and Tibet. HH the Dalai Lama wrote the foreword to the book.
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number PZ90 .T58R67.

data.Name: Baby Buddhas
Author: Lisa Desmond
data.Notes: This book can help children as young as eighteen months to learn how to meditate. The book includes full explanations, instructional illustrations, and testimonials from parents. With different meditation practices for various ages, abilities, and goals there is something here for everyone. Let’s learn how to meditate as a family!
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ5436 .D47.

data.Name: Words of Wisdom
Author: Lama Surya Das
data.Notes: This collection of maxims by non-sectarian Tibetan Buddhist teacher Lama Surya Das is a great source of advice for people of all ages. Pick up the book whenever you need a quick dose of wisdom.
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ5660 .S87.

data.Name: How Will I Behave Today and the Rest of My Life?
Author: Venerable Wuling
data.Notes: This book is based around maxims from the book Guidelines for Being a Good Person, which were inspired by translations of Di Zi Gui, a centuries old children’s book based on ancient Confucian classics. It shows how to and why we should carry out these maxims, in an easily understandable manner for children. The author, Venerable Wuling, is an American Buddhist nun of the Pure Land school of Mahayana Buddhism.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: Buddha’s Little Instruction Book
Author: Jack Kornfield
data.Notes: This book includes practical Buddhist teachings and meditation practices for people of all ages. Let’s apply these maxims and methods in our own lives!
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ5405 .K67.

data.Name: Buddha at Bedtime
Author: Dharmachari Nagaraja
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This book is great for Buddhist beginners. It includes an introduction for parents and children on the origins and key concepts of Buddhism, a step-by-step meditation guide suitable for children, and twenty Jataka tales with their key Buddhist teachings highlighted at the end of the stories. Let’s all lay the foundation for a more compassionate life!
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number J294.38 .N13B.

data.Name: Samsara Dog
Author: Helen Manos
data.Notes: This book is a great natural way to introduce young children to the ideas of death, reincarnation, Samsara, Nirvana, and loving kindness. It follows a dog throughout his many reincarnations, until he finally is free from Samsara after understanding loving kindness. What are some of our own experiences with death?
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number PZ7 .M3166.

data.Name: Himalaya Vanishing Cultures
Author: Jan Reynolds
data.Notes: This book is a great introduction for children into the Sherpa way of life. What can we learn from these Buddhist Himilayan people?
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number DS485 .H6R48.

data.Name: Tibetan Buddhist Altars A Pop-Up Gallery of Traditional Art and Wisdom
Author: Robert Beer
data.Notes: This book is perfect for an addition to or the beginning of your family shrine. It includes pop-up versions of traditional thangkas for five deities. Each altar image of the deity is accompanied by a mantra for and basic information about said deity. It’s design makes it great for mantra recitation, meditation, and travel. Start your own altar at home!
data.Access: It can be ordered online.

data.Name: The Fourth of July New Dimensions of Freedom
Author: Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche
data.Notes: This collection of essays is perfect for any Buddhist American who is wondering about the connection between America and Buddhism. It highlights and celebrates the shared values and symbols between both heritages. It also documents the spread of dharma in the US. The essays were originally speeches given on Fourth of July celebrations by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Why should Buddhist Americans feel proud and grateful for their forefathers?
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: Five Voices Five Faiths An Interfaith Primer
Author: Book
Anantanand Rambachan
Yaakov Ariel
Patricia Phelan
Amanda Millay Hughes
Amy Nelson
data.Notes: This primer shows what is special about The Dharma, amongst the major religions of the world. Designed to teach people about religions they may have no experience with, it is a great way to learn about the differences and similarities between various faiths. The Abbess of the Chapel Hill Zen Center wrote the section on Buddhism. Let’s be tolerant of other religions and remember the uniqueness of The Dharma!
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: The Heart Treasure of the Enlightened Ones
Author: Patrul Rinpoche
with commentary by Dilgo Khyentse
data.Notes: A beautiful lyric poem by the great 17th century Nyingma Saint Patrul Rinpoche extolling the true meaning of compassion and how to practice it in our daily lives. The commentary is made by the great Nyingma master Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ4138 .T55.

data.Name: Lundeeria: The Tale of a Journey to Another Land, Courage, and Compassion
Author: Venerable Wuling
data.Notes: This fictional tale by Venerable Wuling, an American Buddhist nun of the Pure Land school of Mahayana Buddhism, advocates that children have compassion for animals. It presents all animals as fully sentient beings who are worthy of respect and encourages going vegetarian. What can we do to help alleviate the suffering of animals?
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: Zen Ties
Author: Jon J Muth
data.Notes: This delightful tale teaches children kindness in the tradition of Japanese Zen Buddhism in a subtle manner. Children will be so captivated by the plot, the haikus that Koo the panda speaks in, and illustrations, that they will not realize the important lessons they are learning. We should all be kind to everyone, regardless of what we first think of them!
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: The Banyan Deer A Parable of Courage and Compassion
Author: Rafe Martin
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This retelling of a traditional Buddhist “Nigrodhamiga-jataka”, a story of one of the Buddha’s past lives, will captivate children and adults alike with its simple truth and beautiful prose. Let’s learn to treat animals with compassion like the banyan deer!
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1470 .N5522.

data.Name: A Treasury of Wise Action
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: Jataka tales hold great wisdom and can inspire positive action, but most modern retellings are aimed towards young children. This anthology of Jataka Tales was designed specifically for older children, so they too can reap the benefits of these wonderful stories. Let’s all be inspired to undertake good deeds! The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: The Power of a Promise
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This Jataka tale shows how truth, wisdom, and courage can overcome anger. How can we deal with anger in our own lives? The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: The Jewel of Friendship
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A boy learns the true value of friendship after a fallout with his friend over greed. Who are your true friends? The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: Buddhist Masters of Enchantment, the lives and legends of the Mahasiddhas
Author: Keith Dowman
Illustrator: Robert Beer, color plate for each of the Siddhas
data.Notes: This is an accessible book of stories and pictures. It seems to be aimed at a broader demographic than Dowman’s “Masters of Mahamudra, Songs and Histories of the Eighty-Four Buddhist Siddhas”. In this book each Siddha has a chapter and color plate illustration and their story is told. The book has an extensive introduction with includes: the Siddha Tradition; Defining Our Terms; A Look at Tantras; Thought and Paradox; Skillful Means and Perfect Insight; Pure Pleasure; The Guru; The Cremation Ground; Initiation and Instruction; Alchemy and Meditation: Creative Meditation; Fulfillment Meditatioin; Achieving Mahamudra; Traps of Delusion; Karma; The Holy Madman; The Paradise of the Dakinis; and, The Legacy of Tantra. Each section of the introduction is substantial and sophisticated and runs about a page in length. This book does not have and index, notes, bibliography or glossary.
data.Access: It can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ342 .A2313.

data.Name: Tashi and Norbu
Author: Pema Gellek
data.Notes: Tashi learns the true meaning of friendship and value of all life, when he embarks on a journey to save his best friend Norbu, the yak. What can we do to help the animals we love? The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: The Life of Marpa the Translator
Author: Tsang Nyon Heruka
Translated from the Tibetan by the Nalanda Translation Committee under the direction of Chogyam Trungpa
data.Notes: A biography of the Tantric master credited with establishing the Kagyu lineage. The book chronicles Marpa's three trips from Tibet to India to recover traditions and teachings which had been suppressed in Tibet by a nasty king. Marpa was not a monk, but a “householder, farmer, husband, and father. He ate good food, drank lots of barley beer, and lost his temper with his wife and children… Marpa did not try to become a special or different kind of person, but simply used his ordinariness as a path, and as such it became the expression of the ground and and fruition of his realization of mahamudra.” (from the book’s introduction). The book includes the story of his journey as a youth. It contains an extensive glossary, index, and helpful table of contents.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ767 .M37.

data.Name: Masters of Mahamudra, Songs and Histories of the Eighty-Four Buddhist Siddhas
Author: Keith Dowman
data.Notes: This is quite a scholarly work. Each of the eighty-four have their own chapter. Each chapter has: two or three lines of the particular siddha’s “song of realization”;  the legend of the master which includes their meditation instruction; a section, “sadhana” explicating the meditation in the story; and a historiography. The introduction gives extensive historical, cultural, and philosophical context.  The stories of the Eighty-Four Buddhist Siddhas were translated into Tibetan in the 8th-12th centuries.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ342 .A313.

data.Name: Buddhism For Young Students
Author: Ven. C. Phangcham, Ph.D.
Tags: Buddha's teachings aka Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, interdependent origination, five aggregates, etc.
Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Publisher: The Council of Thai Bhikkhus in the U.S.A.
data.Notes: Developed by a master in the Theravada tradition, this well-known book is part of the beginner’s curriculum. Its subject addresses Buddhism’s history, special days, approach to social issues along with applications for daily life, and a few of the famous Jataka Tales. It consists of 30 short lessons divided into 3 parts. The language is friendly, and each lesson presents objectives along with expected results.
data.Access: This book is available from CTB in the USA, 110 Rustic Rd. Centereach, NY 11720 USA.

data.Name: Buddha: Buddhism for kids
data.Notes: This app costs $0.99 and is available in English and Spanish, only on the App Store for iOS devices. It is an interactive story of the life of the Buddha adapted especially for kids. The cartoons are light and fun, a great introduction to the Buddha’s life and childhood.

data.Name: Buddha Quotes - Daily Buddhism
data.Notes: This is a free iOS app that features quotes from the Buddha and other famous Buddhist teachers every day. It also includes music, stories, and a gallery of pictures!

data.Name: Buddhism and Mindfulness Meditation
Tags: Buddha's teachings aka Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, interdependent origination, five aggregates, etc.
data.Notes: This free app is based on the book The Buddhist Way to Peace of Mind by the Thai forest tradition master Venerable Pramote Pamojjo. You can read the 120 page ebook with illustrations, or watch an 80 minute animation with English narrations. It is a good introduction to Buddhist thoughts.

data.Name: Imagine Clarity
data.Notes: This app is about training one’s mind through meditation, which can be transformed to cultivate basic human qualities such as benevolence, compassion, inner peace and inner strength. The app offers an option for a monthly or yearly plan, but also makes available some free content. Through various different modes of guided meditation, audio, and other contemplative aspects of arts, the creators of the app encourage us to change the world from within ourselves.

data.Name: Buddhify
data.Notes: On-the-go meditation app developed with the intention of ultimately helping users reach a place of self-sufficiency without any further need for the app. The meditation sessions are categorized according to topics, as well as duration, to fit interests and schedules. Created by Rohan Gunatillake, mindfulness practitioner, this app costs $4.99.

data.Name: To Love is To Care and Be Kind
data.Lyrics: Be kind to all your friends and family/Be kind to cats and butterflies and trees/Don’t hurt the fishes swimming in the sea/Here is what the Buddha says to me/To love is to care for all living around us/To love is to be kind to all beings around us
data.Access: https://youtu.be/z0YlBA8iNKQ

data.Name: Birth of the Buddha
data.Lyrics: In the ancient land/A child is born/Once in a time so long/And the gods and men/So they said/Homage to the Lord/*Namo tassa bhagavato arahato/Samma-sambuddhassa./*Translation:/Homage to that Lord, the Worthy One,/Perfectly enlightened by Himself.
data.Access: https://youtu.be/0QNUKcwohcg

data.Name: Come and Sit by my Side
data.Lyrics: Come and sit by my side if you’re lonely,/Close your eyes drink some tea together,/Breathing in breathing out, smile and calm,/You will feel that the life is so true./Come and sit by my side if you’re tired,/Close your eyes put your hands on your heart,/Breathing in breathing out, smile and calm,/You will feel that the life is so true./Come and sit by my side if you cry,/Close your eyes put your hands on the earth,/Breathing in breathing out, smile and calm,/You will feel that the life is happy
data.Access: https://youtu.be/bqj42JAUxE4

data.Name: Lord Buddha Short Stories For Kids in English - Inspiring Stories From The Life of Buddha
data.Notes: These cartoons tell stories of Buddha’s birth and his life. Each of the short stories are approximately 35 minutes long.
data.Access: https://youtu.be/sU1Gv-MkH0U

data.Name: The Buddha: A Film
data.Notes: This 2010 PBS Documentary is available on Amazon (Free with Amazon Prime). The Buddha’s life narrated by Richard Gere was undertaken in conjunction with the Asia Society Museum. The movie is 112 minutes long and includes a timeline of major events in the Buddha’s life, a map of India, Buddhist art, related articles by and interviews with contemporary Western Buddhist teachers, games, and resources for teaching mindfulness.
data.Access: Amazon Prime, DVD or Blue-ray

data.Name: The Cup
data.Notes: From the monastery at the foothills of the Himalayas, students eager to watch the World Cup will do everything they can to reach their goal. Through much effort, the student monks attempt to hook up a satellite dish to the monastery. Despite the general lightheartedness tone, the movie released in 1999 also depicts the challenges faced by the abbot as he struggles to teach ancient Buddhism in an increasingly modernized society. Dzongsar Khyentse Rinpoche, director and writer of this interesting movie, has received many accolades and awards for his films.
data.Access: Amazon Prime

data.Name: The Monk and the Yak
Author: Ori Avnur
data.Notes: This is a story about friendship and loyalty between a lonely monk and his yak who live together in the mountains.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Virtues of a Great Warrior
Author: Ori Avnur
data.Notes: A Great Warrior trains to increase his skillfulness in the art of the sword, and learns that without practicing with correct motivation, his skill can be more harm than good.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Jose the Flying Acrobat
Author: Ori Avnur
data.Notes: Despite becoming the most talented acrobat in the land, Jose feels something missing in his life. One day he learns an important lesson about finding freedom and joy within himself.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: The Commander and the Wise Monk
Author: Ori Avnur
data.Notes: This is a Buddhist tale about how compassion can triumph over any weapon or strength.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: One Step at a Time
Author: Ori Avnur
data.Notes: Read about the special friendship between a boy and girl that requires courage to do the right thing. This book helps children develop awareness about their own feelings, particularly those of grief, regret, and shame.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Wide Awake A Buddhist Guide for Teens
Author: Diana Winston
Tags: Buddha's teachings aka Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, interdependent origination, five aggregates, etc.
data.Notes: Geared towards teens, this book offers advice on various topics within the lens of Buddhism, including discovering truth, finding peace, acceptance, and meditation.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ5670 .W46.

data.Name: Buddha’s Apprentice at Bedtime
Author: Dharmachari Nagaraja
data.Notes: A compilation of stories inspired by the teachings of the Buddha, and contains themes such as compassion and managing one's emotions and thoughts.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Nightlights: Stories for You to Read to Your Child – To Encourage Calm, Confidence and Creativity
Author: Kate Petty
Joyce Dunbar
Louisa Somerville
data.Notes: An interactive book with illustrated visualizations that help children realize their potential. Also offers advice on meditation and affirmation for children.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: The Calm Buddha at Bedtime
Author: Dharmachari Nagaraja
data.Notes: A compilation of 18 ancient Buddhist tales to teach children about wisdom, compassion, mindfulness, and more.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ5810 .N34.

data.Name: The Barefoot Book of Buddhist Tales
Author: Sherab Chödzin
data.Notes: A collection of Buddhist tales from India, China, Japan and Tibet. Themes include kindness, generosity, dangers of selfishness, freedom, and more. The author was a close student of the Tibetan meditation master and founder of the Shambala lineage Chögyam Trungpa Rinpoche.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ5810 .C56.

data.Name: Kindness: A Treasury of Buddhist Wisdom for Children and Parents
Author: Sarah Conover
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A collection of Buddhist stories and fables with themes of wisdom, compassion, and more. The author is a Theravada practitioner who teaches meditation and creative writing.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1032 .C66.

data.Name: Basic Buddhism Through Comics
Author: Mitsutoshi Furuya
data.Notes: This comic-style book of Buddhism is suitable for both children and adults. It contains 23 sections that offer easy and simple descriptions of Buddhist concepts, as well as advice on how to apply them in daily life.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: The Golden Goose and Other Jataka Stories
Author: Dhammika Himi, S.
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This is a compilation of five jataka tales presented in comic-book style for young readers.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Buddhist Animal Wisdom Stories
Author: Mark W. McGinnis
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A collection of 44 jataka tales with themes of kindness, cooperation, and loyalty, rewritten by the author who is an artist and educator.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462.E5 M45.

data.Name: Buddhist Studies for Primary and Secondary Students
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
Buddha's teachings aka Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, interdependent origination, five aggregates, etc.
data.Publisher: Buddha Dharma Education Association and BuddhaNet
data.Notes: This extensive and well-developed Mahayana curriculum contains units on the Buddha’s life story, refuge, morality, meditation, Guided meditations, groups activities, stories, songs, puzzles, plays, quizzes.
data.Access: www.buddhanet.net

data.Name: Buddhism for Kids
Tags: Buddha's teachings aka Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, interdependent origination, five aggregates, etc.
data.Notes: This website, developed by three Western Buddhist monastics practicing in the Chinese tradition at of the City of Ten Thousand Buddhas, Ukiah Valley California, contains a number of useful materials for teachers to use with children, including clear definitions of core tenets of the Mahayana teachings.
data.Access: www.buddhismforkids.net

data.Name: Bodhi Kids
Tags: Buddha's teachings aka Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, interdependent origination, five aggregates, etc.
data.Notes: This website contains inspiration for youth, parents, and teachers on family relationships, personal growth, and parenting. It includes interviews with Tibetan Buddhist masters on family life and child raising.
data.Access: www.bodhikids.org

data.Name: Unmistaken Child
data.Notes: Released in 2008, this is a touching 102 minute-long documentary on the search of Geshe Lama Konchog's reincarnation by his attendant and long time student, Tenzin Zopa. The documentary follows the monk as he struggles to accomplish his task, who ultimately reaches success. Beautiful landscape from Nepal and remote Tibetan villages faithfully display Buddhist culture.
data.Access: Amazon Prime

data.Name: Legend Of Buddha
data.Notes: This is a beautiful animated portrait of the life of Gautama Buddha, in Hindi with English subtitles. Released in 2004, the 87-minute-long film attempts to recount the existential struggle of Siddhartha in his search for the ultimate truth and achieving enlightenment. The story is based on events told by Sir Edwin Arnold in his poem 'The Light of Asia'.
data.Access: https://youtu.be/PRstl25nVCw

data.Name: Chinese Buddhist Encyclopedia
Tags: Buddha's teachings aka Four Noble Truths, Eightfold Path, interdependent origination, five aggregates, etc.
data.Notes: This website claims to be an online tool to preserve Buddhist materials digitally and expand the existing amount by collecting and categorizing them in order to make Buddhism easily accessible for the young and future generations.
data.Access: www.chinabuddhismencyclopedia.com

data.Name: Jataka Tales of the Buddha Volume 1
Author: Ken & Visakha Kawasaki
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This is the retelling of 217 jataka tales that spans across three volumes, written in modern and simple language. Aligned closer to the original Pali version, these stories of Buddha’s past births reveal the result of the challenges he faced in various forms of life along the path to becoming a Buddha. While accessible by young readers, these stories are more suitable for advanced readers. A Glossary of Terms and Personal Names is included.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Buddha Stories
Author: Demi
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This is a beautiful collection of jataka tales, with accompanying detailed brushwork illustrations. Each tale is written in simple language, demonstrating a lesson encountered in Buddha’s previous lives. The moral is summarized in a concise sentence following the tale.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462.ESD46.

data.Name: Twenty Jataka Tales
Author: Noor Inayat
data.Notes: Readers of this compilation will find deep and meaningful stories that demonstrate harmonious relationships and understanding between living beings. Suitable for a wide range of readers.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: The Victorious Teen: Buddhist Advice for Dealing with What Life Throws at You
Author: Daisaku Ikeda
data.Notes: This is a compilation of numerous excerpts from Daisaku Ikeda on myriad topics and thoughts faced by young people. With the intention to encourage and inspire the reader, the advice found in this book draws from Buddhist viewpoints, lives of famous individuals, and Ikeda’s personal experience.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Under the Bodhi Tree: A Story of the Buddha
Author: Deborah Hopkinson
data.Notes: A wonderful introduction to the life and story of the Buddha with beautiful illustrations that will capture the attention of young readers.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ892.H67.

data.Name: The Show-Off Monkey and other Taoist Tales
Author: Mark W. McGinnis
data.Notes: A compilation of thirty-three short traditional Taoist tales with themes of acceptance, humility, and simplicity. Readers will get a glimpse of the Taoist view of living in harmony with the world, and learn many lessons in the process.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BL1942.5.M35.

data.Name: Little Lotus and the Loving-Kindness Cup
Author: Susan Tidwell
data.Notes: Little Lotus’s school is holding a recycling drive competition. All goes well until Little Lotus becomes overly competitive and can’t think of anything else but winning. Read about how Little Lotus overcomes this challenge.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Three Virtuous Brothers: A Story of the Three Acts of Goodness
Author: Susan Tidwell
data.Notes: This is the tale of three brothers who live happily together, until one day, they begin to quarrel as a result of their selfish actions. Read about their troubles, and how a mysterious elderly woman appears one evening and shows them how to resolve their issues.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Little Panka Sweeps the Mind
Author: Fa Ze
data.Notes: This is the story of Culapanthaka, also known as Little Panka. No matter what Little Panka does, he can’t seem to remember anything from his teachers. Eventually, Little Panka finds himself in total despair after unsuccessfully memorizing a simple Dharma saying. He is met by the Buddha who shows him compassion and teaches him a valuable lesson.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: The Patriarch of Chan
Author: Wang Meizhi
data.Notes: This is the life story of Bodhidharma, an Indian monk who journeyed to China and establishes the Chan lineage. It is written as a graphic novel that will captivate readers through its storyline and illustrations.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ9299.B627W3613.

data.Name: The Short March to Wisdom
Author: Venerable Yun Dong and Marjorie Jacobs
data.Notes: This is a collection of thirty-two illustrated Buddhist stories adapted from Sutras and made relevant to today’s world. Each short story includes six discussion questions at the end, and is suitable for both self-study as well as guided instruction.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Wind and Rain: The Life of Ikkyu
Author: Venerable Miao You
data.Notes: This is the biography of Master Ikkyu, who was known for being a quick-witted and clever monk integral to Chan Buddhism. Readers will find be enticed by this graphic novel as they page through the engaging and energetic illustrated story.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ9399.I567M5313.

data.Name: The Sweeper: A Buddhist Tale
Author: Rebecca Hazell
data.Notes: This is a tale inspired by Buddhist tradition about a young servant named Padme. One day she meets the Buddha who instructors her how to be mindful and meditate even in the midst of her busy workday. Beautifully illustrated, this is a great way to introduce children to the concept of mindful meditation.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ4032.H39.

data.Name: The Coconut Monk
Author: Thich Nhat Hanh
data.Notes: This book is based on the life of Dao Dua, also known as the 'Coconut Monk', who set an example for peaceful living with one another. The concept of peace is demonstrated through the loving friendship of a cat and mouse, encouraging the reader to think about the themes of friendship, peacemaking, and nonviolence.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ4032.N58.

data.Name: When the Buddha Was an Elephant
Author: Mark McGinnis
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A collection of jataka tales of Buddha’s previous animal lives, suitable for readers of all ages. The tales reveal consequences that result from negative tendencies of mankind, and offer an alternate way of living more harmonious with the world.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462.EM46.

data.Name: The Golden Goose King: A Tale Told by the Buddha
Author: Judith Ernst
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This is a detailed and elaborate retelling of “The Golden Goose King,“ a jataka tale about the Buddha’s previous life as the Goose King. It is an engaging story about loyalty and self-sacrifice that can be enjoyed by readers of all ages.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462.E5E76.

data.Name: Now I Know…That it’s Better to Face My Monsters
Author: Sally Devorsine
data.Notes: This book is one of the “Now I Know…“ eight-book series by Sally Devorsine. The book is inspired and based on Tibetan Buddhist master Geshe Langri Thangpa’s ”Eight Verses of Mind Training“. Through this captivating and relatable story, young readers can learn about the Tibetan values of how to secure happiness.

data.Name: The Adventures of Tashi, the Tibetan Cricket
Author: Tsering Paldron
data.Notes: Read about Tashi, a cricket from Tibet, and the many adventures he takes with his friends. Despite being a children’s books, the profound themes of rebirth, reincarnation, and meditation are prevalent in the story and provides a valuable introduction to these important Tibetan values.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: The Monkey King
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: The Monkey King sacrifices his life to save his tribe after they are attacked by humans. In doing so, he teaches the King of Benares how to be a caring and just ruler. The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1462.E5D386.

data.Name: The Proud Peacock
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: The golden mallard’s daughter searches the entire kingdom for a suitable mate, eventually choosing an elegant peacock. She soon discovers his prideful nature and rejects him for a more humble mate. The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ1470.N5322 E534.

data.Name: The Spade Sage
Author: Dharma Publishing
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: A gardener learns the power of attachment through his only possession, a garden spade. Through his journey he learns the secret of happiness. The publishing company and writing group behind this book was founded by Tibetan Nyingma Buddhist Lama Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche. Recent editions are accompanied with lesson suggestions for parents and teachers in the back.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Happy Veggies
Author: Mayumi Oda
data.Notes: Celebrate Mother Earth through this colorful book with a myriad of garden vegetables as the main subject. This book will encourage children to see the garden as a place full of life and grow an appreciation for nature.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number SB324.O34.

data.Name: Is Nothing Something?: Kids’ Questions and Zen Answers About Life, Death, Family, Friendship, and Everything in Between
Author: Thich Nhat Hanh
data.Notes: This is a book of questions and answers about a myriad number of topics that can help readers of all ages, in all walks of life. Beautifully illustrated, readers are sure to find advice, peace, and understanding through these pages.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ9800.T5392.

data.Name: Mr. Pack Rat Really Wants That
Author: Marcus Ewert
data.Notes: Mr. Pack Rat builds a beautiful nest with plain sticks and leaves. Unfortunately, he quickly grows quite unsatisfied of his monotone nest. He begins to collect all sorts of things, and while at first it brings him happiness, he finds a reason to be dissatisfied soon thereafter. Readers will discover how Mr. Pack Rat solves his problem and eventually finds happiness.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number PZ7.E94717.

data.Name: Peace, Bugs and Understanding: An Adventure in Sibling Harmony
Author: Gail Silver
data.Notes: Lily is trying to enjoy a picnic with her father and her younger sister Ruby, but Ruby is spoiling everything. Lily’s father gives her a journal written by her great grandfather, and Lily reads about Metta, which means wishing for the happiness of others. Lily uses Metta to help transform her anger towards Ruby into loving kindness.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number PZ7.S58567PE.

data.Name: Steps and Stones
Author: Gail Silver
data.Notes: In this sequel to Anh’s Anger, Anh finds himself alone and angry when his friends don’t want to play with him during recess. When his anger arises, Anh discovers a way to confront and calm his emotions.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number PZ7.S58567ST.

data.Name: Under the Rose Apple Tree
Author: Thich Nhat Hanh
data.Notes: The teachings of Buddha are presented in a relevant and approachable way, more suitable for adolescents and adults. This book provides wisdom on “When Things Get Difficult,“ “Learning to Love,” and more.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ5405.N5.

data.Name: Virtuous Heart: Twelve Buddhist Stories to Awaken and Inspire
Author: Leza Lowitz
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: This is the retelling of twelve jataka tales written in modern language. The author uniquely begins each tale from the perspective of the villain, setting the scene for the ethical dilemma. Readers of all ages will take away lessons of compassion, loyalty, forgiveness, and more.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library.

data.Name: Shantideva: How to Wake Up A Hero
Author: Dominique Townsend
data.Notes: This is Shantideva’s guide to becoming a bodhisattva, originally presented to an audience in India in the eight century. The teachings are written in a manner suitable for adolescents, or for parents and teachers to read to young children, in which being a bodhisattva is likened to being a superhero. Readers regardless of age will be encouraged to attain this superhero status through consistent practice and aspiration for a more virtuous lifestyle.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online and is also available in the TKL library, call number BQ984.N85T68.

data.Name: The Rakshasa Ghost and the Bhikshu (Buddha's Wisdom, Vol. 1)
Author: Venerable Master Hsuan Hua
Tags: Buddha's previous lives aka Jataka tales
data.Notes: Stories of Shakyamuni Buddha’s cultivation in past lives when he was a Bodhisattva. This book teaches children on the Bodhisattva’s kindness, compassion, joy and giving.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: The Truly Awakened one (Buddha’s Wisdom, Vol. II)
Author: Venerable Master Hsuan Hua
data.Notes: Story of Shakyamuni Buddha’s life told by one of the most eminent Chinese Buddhist masters of the twentieth century. This book teaches children on the Bodhisattva’s kindness, compassion, joy and giving.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.

data.Name: Spider’s Thread
Author: Buddhist Text Translation Society (translation)
data.Notes: The story shows we are responsible for our own actions and talks about the power of forgiveness.
data.Access: This book can be ordered online.
